content.1: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
content.2: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.
content.3: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)
content.4: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
content.5: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.
content.6: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but
content.7: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
content.8: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.
content.10: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
content.11: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.
content.12: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.
content.13: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except
content.14: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
content.15: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
content.16: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
content.17: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?
content.19: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but
